name: Allen, Peter Thatcher
title: Trustee
ngos: The Dawn Redwoods Charitable Trust (Trustee) - supports Bohemian arts-based culture preservation

name: Bass, Edward P
title: Chairman
political_donations: Donated $10,000 to Republican Party of Texas (2008); $21,375 to McCain-Palin Victory 2008. Documented FEC records as self-employed, Fort Worth TX 76102.
ngos: World Wildlife Fund (Director Emeritus, served 1988-2007); Yale Corporation (Successor Trustee 2001-2013, Senior Fellow 2011-2013); Sid W. Richardson Foundation (Chairman, Board of Directors); Philecology Trust (Founding Trustee); Philecology Foundation (Founding Trustee); New York Botanical Garden (Executive Committee); Botanical Research Institute of Texas (Executive Committee); National Environmental Education Foundation (Honorary Trustee)
notes: Fort Worth billionaire, heir to Bass family oil fortune. Born September 10, 1945. Financed and co-founded Biosphere 2 project (1984-1991), an artificial closed ecological system in Oracle, Arizona. Led Sundance Square urban revitalization in downtown Fort Worth starting 1982. Funded Bass Performance Hall (opened 1998) without public funding. Named Forbes 400 #239 in 2012 with ~$2 billion net worth. 2019 Fort Worth Business Executive of the Year.

name: Baxter, Charles B.
title: Director; Chairman, Rakuten USA Inc.
notes: Also Chairman of Wineshipping.com LLC and formerly Director of Buy.com Inc. and LinkShare Corporation. Has served on Rakuten board since 2001 (with a gap 2003-2011).

name: Baxter, Thomas W.
title: Of Counsel
notes: Corporate finance lawyer based in Los Angeles with nearly 30 years at O'Melveny. Specializes in banking, capital markets, leveraged buyouts, debt restructurings. J.D. from UC College of the Law San Francisco (1983), magna cum laude. Recognized by Chambers USA and IFLR as Leading Lawyer for banking and capital markets.

name: Bohannon, David D. II
title: President
notes: Leads the Bohannon Companies, a San Mateo-based real estate development and management firm founded by his grandfather David D. Bohannon in 1928. The company owns approximately 85 acres in Menlo Park and 1.2 million square feet of retail space including the Hillsdale Shopping Center.

name: Bohannon, Scott E.
title: Senior Vice President
notes: Younger brother of David D. Bohannon II. Works at the family-owned Bohannon Development Company in San Mateo, California.

name: Browning, Christopher Mose
notes: Registered investment adviser per SEC IAPD (CRD# 1268304). Based in San Francisco Bay Area.

name: Buss, David H.
title: Executive Chair
notes: Retired U.S. Navy Vice Admiral. Served nearly four decades in the Navy, retiring in 2015 as Commander, Naval Air Forces (the Navy's 'Air Boss'). Post-retirement career included President of Cubic Global Defense, CEO of OpenDrives. Also joined Academy Securities Advisory Board and Geopolitical Intelligence Group. Documented in POGO Pentagon Revolving Door database. Graduate of the U.S. Naval Academy.

name: Crowell, Richard R.
title: Founder and Managing Partner
notes: Founded Vance Street Capital in 2007, a middle-market private equity firm focused on industrial technology, medical, aerospace, and defense. Previously co-founded Aurora Capital Group (1991). Board member of RBC Bearings Inc. since 2002. B.A. from UC Santa Cruz; MBA from UCLA Anderson.

name: Dickason, Bradford S.
title: Principal
notes: Over 30 years of experience in urban real estate development, entitlements, and building operations in the San Francisco Bay Area. Based in Orinda, California. Previously VP at AF Evans Development, Inc. and Catellus Urban Development.

name: Evans, Robert Beverley Jr.
title: Chairman and CEO
notes: Chairman and CEO of Evans Industries Inc., a private equity firm based in Troy, Michigan, investing in American manufacturing companies. Son of Robert Beverley Evans Sr. (1906-1998), who turned around American Motors and other companies. The firm was spun off from Evans Products Company in 1955.

name: Fisher, John H. N.
title: Chairman
political_donations: Major Republican donor. Gave $5 million to anti-Obama dark money group (2010-2012). Contributed over $500,000 to NRCC-affiliated group chaired by Rep. Steve Stivers; $243,000 to Ryan-McCarthy Victory committee (2015). OpenSecrets donor profile documents GOP contributions.
ngos: KIPP Foundation (Chairman of the Board); Charter School Growth Fund (Chair); Oakland Promise (donor)
notes: Son of Gap Inc. founders Donald and Doris Fisher. Manages Pisces Inc., the Fisher family investment office since 1992. Principal owner of Major League Baseball's Oakland Athletics (moved to Sacramento, heading to Las Vegas). Also owns San Jose Earthquakes (MLS). Lifelong Republican with history working for RNC, Ronald Reagan, and VP George H.W. Bush. Major charter school education reform philanthropist.

name: Goonewardene, Nihal W.
title: Treasurer and Secretary, Board Executive Committee
ngos: Population Reference Bureau (Treasurer & Secretary, Board Executive Committee); Tufts University Fletcher School (Board of Overseers); Results for Development (Senior Fellow); Brookings Institution (Non-Resident Senior Fellow)
notes: Retired in 2012 as President and CEO of the International Science and Technology Institute (ISTI), Inc. in Washington, D.C., after 34 years (co-founded ISTI in 1978, became CEO in 1991). ISTI provided development consulting in over 60 countries. Sri Lankan-American development professional. M.A. from Tufts Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy (1973).

name: Gordon, Robert Cochran III
title: Attorney
notes: California-licensed attorney (Bar #73356, admitted 1976). Located in San Francisco, CA. J.D. from UC Hastings College of the Law; undergraduate from University of California.

name: Jasper, N. W. (Bill) Jr.
title: Director Emeritus (former President and CEO)
ngos: Sonoma Media Investments, LLC (Director); BioQ Pharma (Board of Directors)
notes: N.W. (Bill) Jasper Jr. joined Dolby Laboratories in 1979 as VP, Finance and Administration. Named President in 1983 and served as President and CEO until retiring March 27, 2009. Continued on Dolby Board of Directors until retiring from board, receiving honorary title of Director Emeritus after 40+ years of service. B.S. in industrial engineering from Stanford University; MBA from UC Berkeley.

name: Le Fevre, A. Scott
title: CEO and CIO
notes: Based in San Francisco, CA. Previously Managing Director at Atlas Capital Advisors LLC and Co-Founder, CFO and COO of Glenbrook Capital. Also served as Board Member and Chair of the Audit Committee for Fisher Investments Purisima Funds. B.A. in Physical Sciences and English Literature from UC Berkeley.

name: McDowell, Malcolm
title: Actor
notes: British-American actor born Malcolm John Taylor on June 13, 1943 in Horsforth, Yorkshire. Trained at LAMDA. Breakthrough role as Alex DeLarge in Stanley Kubrick's A Clockwork Orange (1971). Also known for If... (1968), O Lucky Man! (1973), Star Trek: Generations (1994), Time After Time (1979), Halloween (2007). Received American citizenship in 2021. Stars in CBC comedy series Son of a Critch (2022-present, casting as 'Pop'). Over 100 film and television credits.

name: Muller, Martin
title: Founder, Owner, and President
notes: Founded Modernism Gallery in San Francisco in October 1979, the first commercial gallery south of Market Street in SF. Born in Geneva; studied at the Florimont Institute; BA and MA in art history from University of Geneva. Opened a second location (Modernism West) in the Mission District in 2004. Presented first Bay Area gallery exhibition of Andy Warhol (1982) and first West Coast gallery show of Russian Avant-Garde (1980). Awarded Chevalier des Arts et des Lettres by French Minister of Culture in 2010; elevated to Officier des Arts et des Lettres in 2023.

name: O'Brien, Conan
title: Host and Executive Producer
political_donations: Lifetime FEC donations of approximately $5,600, all to Democratic candidates. Registered Democrat since 1984.
notes: Television host, comedian, writer. Born April 18, 1963 in Brookline, Massachusetts. Harvard graduate (history, 1985). Hosted Late Night with Conan O'Brien (NBC, 1993-2009), The Tonight Show with Conan O'Brien (NBC, 2009-2010), Conan (TBS, 2010-2021). Sold Team Coco podcast company to SiriusXM for $150 million in 2022; signed 5-year talent deal. Hosts Conan O'Brien Needs a Friend podcast and Conan O'Brien Radio channel. Hosted 97th Academy Awards (2025) and renewed for 2026 Oscars. Received Mark Twain Prize for American Humor.

name: Pasternak, Eddie
notes: A person named Eddie Pasternak appears in IMDB as a set decorator (known for Great Performances, Camera Three, The Jackie Gleason Show). Cannot confirm this is the same individual.

name: Spiegel, Andrew E.
notes: Based in San Rafael, California (Marin County). Associated with Culloden Park Management per LinkedIn.

name: Villareal, Leopoldo
notes: Note: There is a well-known artist named Leo (Leopoldo) Villareal, born 1967 in Albuquerque, known for LED light installations including The Bay Lights on the San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge. If this is the same person, he is Owner of Villareal Studio in Brooklyn, NY, and represented by Pace Gallery. Cannot confirm identity without more data.

name: Violich, Paul A.
title: Founder and Senior Economic Counselor
notes: Founded Violich Capital Management in San Francisco in 1999. Previously Chairman (1980-1999) of Wentworth, Hauser and Violich, where he grew assets under management to over $3 billion. Holds Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation and Chartered Investment Counsel designation. Also serves as President of Violich Farms, Inc., one of California's largest almond and walnut producers, based in Kentfield, CA. Connected to UC Berkeley as major donor to Cal Athletics Fund.
